message:
If you working in web app, and your database will growing by the time with huge amount of data
Wich RDBMS you preferred, oracle or sql server
in the perspective of ( optimization,  acceleration , license,  security, etc )

data.message: Depending on the budget I'd go some true free fork of MySQL like MariaDB, or SQL Server. If government, etc., Oracle might be an option.
For optimization, your mileage will always vary.

I don't recommend Scaling until you are already facing the problem of Scalability. Mysql Can be scaled very nicely using sharding: http://www.slideshare.net/mkindahl/mysql-sharding-tools-and-best-practices-for-horizontal-scaling

I'm against the concept of resolving a problem you don't actually have. so unless you haven't try scaling mysql you can't just start with Oracle. As Mohamed Mentioned it also depends on Infrastructure Budget.
We are moving to MySQL as well this time for licensing
Would you please specify what do you mean by "huge amount of data"?
